name: Hotel Booking Platform
description: Secure hotel booking platform connecting guests with hosts for seamless reservations.

current_prd.elevator_pitch: Our platform provides a secure and seamless hotel booking experience, connecting guests with a wide array of hotel rooms. We empower hosts with robust listing and management tools, while guests enjoy easy search, booking, and payment processing. With dedicated dashboards and notifications, we ensure efficient and transparent interactions for all users, simplifying hotel reservations for everyone.
current_prd.problem_statement: The current hotel booking landscape often presents challenges for both guests and hosts, including fragmented booking processes, lack of secure payment options, and inefficient management of listings and reservations. Guests struggle to find suitable accommodations with transparent availability and pricing, while hosts lack comprehensive tools to effectively manage their properties and bookings, leading to missed opportunities and administrative burdens.
current_prd.solution: Our platform provides a centralized and secure solution for hotel bookings. It offers robust user authentication and role management for guests, hosts, and administrators. Hosts can easily create and manage detailed hotel listings, including availability and pricing. Guests benefit from intuitive search and filtering options, real-time availability calendars, and a streamlined booking process. Secure payment integration with Stripe ensures smooth transactions and refunds. Dedicated dashboards and a comprehensive notification system keep all users informed about booking statuses and relevant activities, thereby simplifying the entire hotel reservation ecosystem.

key_features.feature_description: Secure sign-up and login functionality with distinct profiles and permissions for guests, hosts, and administrators.
Hosts can create, edit, and manage hotel room listings, including detailed descriptions, high-quality images, pricing, real-time availability calendars, and amenities.

Guests can search for hotel rooms using various criteria (location, dates, price range, amenities) and filter results. They can view detailed listing pages, check availability calendars, and select desired dates for booking.
Guests can view their upcoming and past reservations. Hosts can review, approve, or decline booking requests, and manage their booking calendar.
Secure integration with Stripe for processing booking payments, handling refunds, and managing transactions.

Personalized dashboards for guests and hosts to view relevant information (e.g., upcoming bookings, earnings, messages). Email and in-app notifications for booking status changes, new messages, and important updates.

steps: Guest navigates to the platform.
Guest selects 'Sign Up' or 'Login'.
Guest provides email and password (or uses social login).
System authenticates user and creates/accesses guest profile.
Guest is redirected to their dashboard or homepage.
Host logs into their account.
Host navigates to 'My Listings' or 'Add New Listing'.
Host fills out room details (name, description, images, amenities).
Host sets pricing and updates availability calendar.
Host submits the listing for review/publication.
System processes listing and makes it available for guests.
Guest logs into their account.
Guest enters search criteria (location, dates, number of guests).
System displays available listings based on criteria.
Guest views a listing, checks details and availability.
Guest selects desired dates and proceeds to booking.
Guest reviews booking summary and proceeds to payment.
Guest completes payment via Stripe.
System confirms booking and sends notifications to guest and host.
user_flows.flow_name: Guest Searching and Booking a Room

steps: Host logs into their account.
Host navigates to 'My Bookings'.
Host views a new booking request.
Host reviews guest details and booking dates.
Host selects 'Approve' or 'Decline'.
System updates booking status and sends notifications to guest and host.
If approved, system updates availability calendar.
Admin logs into the admin panel.
Admin navigates to 'User Management'.
Admin views a list of all users (guests, hosts).
Admin can search, filter, and view user profiles.
Admin can activate, deactivate, or delete user accounts.
Admin can modify user roles or permissions.
System applies changes and logs administrative actions.
Admin logs into the admin panel.
Admin navigates to 'Listing Management'.
Admin views a list of all hotel listings.
Admin can search, filter, and view listing details.
Admin can approve, reject, or unpublish listings.
Admin can edit listing information (e.g., correct errors, add details).
System applies changes and logs administrative actions.
Guest initiates payment for a booking.
Platform sends payment request to Stripe API with booking details.
Stripe processes the payment and returns a transaction status.
Platform updates booking status to 'Paid' or 'Payment Failed'.
Platform sends payment confirmation/failure notifications to guest and host.
If payment fails, platform may prompt guest to retry or cancel booking.
A relevant event occurs (e.g., new booking, booking approval, payment received).
System identifies affected users (guest, host, admin).
System generates notification content based on event type.
System sends email notification to user's registered email address.
System pushes in-app notification to user's dashboard/app interface.
System logs notification delivery status.

current_prd.success_metrics: Increase successful bookings by 25% within the first year. Achieve a 90% host satisfaction rate with listing and booking management tools. Maintain a 95% uptime for the platform. Process 99% of payments securely and without errors. Achieve a guest satisfaction score of 4.5/5 based on post-stay surveys.
current_prd.competitors: Booking.com, Expedia, Airbnb, Hotels.com, Agoda, TripAdvisor, local hotel chains' direct booking platforms.
current_prd.vision: To become the most trusted and user-friendly hotel booking platform globally, known for its seamless experience, robust security, and comprehensive features that cater to the evolving needs of both travelers and hospitality providers, fostering a vibrant and efficient marketplace for accommodations worldwide.

target_audience.name: Guests (Travelers)
target_audience.pain_points: Fragmented booking experiences, hidden fees, unreliable availability information, complex cancellation policies, lack of trust in unknown platforms.
target_audience.demographics: Individuals, couples, and families aged 25-65, tech-savvy, frequent travelers (business and leisure), value convenience and reliability.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Easy search and booking, wide selection of hotels, transparent pricing and availability, secure payment options, reliable customer support, personalized recommendations.

target_audience.name: Hosts (Hotel Owners/Managers)
target_audience.pain_points: Manual booking management, limited reach, high commission fees from existing platforms, difficulty in managing multiple listings, lack of integrated tools for property management.
target_audience.demographics: Hotel owners, property managers, and hospitality businesses of all sizes, seeking efficient ways to manage bookings and reach a wider audience.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Easy listing creation and management, real-time availability updates, secure payment reception, efficient booking approval/decline process, clear communication with guests, performance analytics.

target_audience.name: Administrators
target_audience.pain_points: Lack of centralized control, inefficient moderation tools, difficulty in tracking platform activity, manual error resolution.
target_audience.demographics: Internal team members responsible for platform operations, user support, content moderation, and system maintenance.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Comprehensive tools for user and listing management, monitoring platform performance, resolving disputes, ensuring data security, generating reports.

phasing.rationale: This phase establishes the fundamental user accounts and allows hosts to create and manage hotel listings. It's a strong demo to showcase the host's ability to onboard and manage their properties, and for administrators to manage users. This phase is 'Demo-able' as it shows the core content creation aspect of the platform.

Building on Phase 1, this phase enables guests to discover listings created by hosts. They can search, filter, view details, and crucially, select dates for booking. This demonstrates the guest-facing discovery and the initial step of the booking process, making it highly 'Demo-able' for the guest journey and suitable for an early beta for guests to explore listings.

This phase completes the core booking lifecycle. Once guests can initiate bookings (from Phase 2), this phase allows hosts to review, approve, or decline those requests and manage their booking calendar, while guests can track their reservations. This makes the platform functional for a 'Beta Launch', allowing real booking interactions (even if payments are handled externally initially).

This final phase integrates secure payment processing, making the platform commercially viable. The addition of personalized dashboards and a comprehensive notification system significantly enhances the user experience, providing transparency and efficient communication, preparing the platform for a full public 'Launch'.

current_prd.design_principles: User-Centricity: Intuitive and easy-to-use interfaces for all user types (guests, hosts, admins). Transparency: Clear information on pricing, availability, and booking policies. Reliability: Secure and stable platform for transactions and data. Efficiency: Streamlined workflows for listing, searching, booking, and managing. Accessibility: Design for diverse users with varying abilities.

user_personas.name: Sarah, The Business Traveler
user_personas.goals: Quickly find and book hotels for business trips, manage itineraries, get clear expense reports.
user_personas.pain_points: Time-consuming search, unclear booking policies, difficulty tracking multiple bookings, lack of corporate integration.

user_personas.name: David, The Boutique Hotelier
user_personas.goals: Maximize occupancy, streamline booking management, showcase unique property features, attract international guests.
user_personas.pain_points: High commission fees from OTAs, manual booking updates, limited control over listing presentation, difficulty reaching niche markets.

user_personas.name: Emily, The Solo Traveler
user_personas.goals: Find affordable and unique accommodations, connect with other travelers, easily manage flexible travel plans.
user_personas.pain_points: Difficulty finding budget-friendly options, limited social features, rigid booking policies, safety concerns in new places.

steps.description: Opens the hotel booking platform.
Logs in with her business account.
Uses the search bar to enter destination, dates, and number of guests.
Displays a list of available hotels matching the criteria.
Filters results by price range and amenities (e.g., Wi-Fi, business center).
Compares a few hotel options, reading reviews and checking photos.
Selects a hotel and proceeds to the booking page.
Shows a summary of the booking, including total cost and cancellation policy.
Enters payment details (corporate card) and confirms the booking.
Processes payment via Stripe and sends a booking confirmation email.
Receives in-app notification and email confirmation with booking details.
Views the booking in her 'Upcoming Trips' dashboard section.
Updates the hotel's availability calendar.
Notifies the host of the new booking.
Receives notification of new booking and reviews details.
Approves the booking from their dashboard.

user_journeys.context: Sarah needs to book a hotel for an upcoming business trip.

steps.description: Logs into the hotel booking platform.
Navigates to the 'My Listings' section.
Clicks on 'Add New Listing'.
Presents a form for new listing details.
Enters room name, description, capacity, and bed type.
Uploads high-quality images of the room and amenities.
Selects available amenities (e.g., Wi-Fi, private bathroom, breakfast).
Sets the base nightly price and any seasonal adjustments.
Updates the availability calendar for the next few months.
Reviews all details and clicks 'Publish Listing'.
Validates the listing information and saves it.
Notifies the host that the listing is live (or pending admin review).
Views the new listing in their 'My Listings' dashboard.
Receives notification of a new listing pending review (if applicable).
Reviews listing details and approves/rejects it.

user_journeys.context: David needs to add a new room listing to his boutique hotel.
user_journeys.trigger: A new room becomes available or a renovation is complete.

steps.description: Opens the hotel booking platform on her mobile phone.
Selects 'Explore' or uses the search bar to enter the city name.
Displays a map view and a list of accommodations in the city.
Filters by 'Hostel' and 'Price (low to high)'.
Browses through the results, looking at photos and reading short descriptions.
Clicks on a promising hostel to view its full profile, including reviews and social features.
Checks the availability calendar for her desired dates.
Selects a bed in a shared dorm and proceeds to book.
Shows a clear breakdown of the cost and any additional fees.
Chooses to pay with a credit card via Stripe.
Processes payment and sends a booking confirmation to her email and in-app.
Adds the booking to her travel itinerary within the app.
Updates the hostel's availability.
Receives notification of a new booking and confirms it automatically (or manually if required).

user_journeys.context: Emily wants to find an affordable hostel in a new city for her backpacking trip.
user_journeys.trigger: Planning a new leg of her backpacking trip.

current_prd.navigation_design:
Guest Navigation:
  - Primary Navigation (Desktop): Top navigation bar with links to Home, Search, My Bookings, Saved, Profile.
  - Primary Navigation (Mobile): Bottom tab bar with icons for Home, Search, My Bookings, Profile.
  - Secondary Navigation: Filters and sorting options on search results pages. Breadcrumbs for deeper navigation.
Host Navigation:
  - Dashboard-centric: Left-hand sidebar navigation on desktop with links to Dashboard, My Listings, My Bookings, Earnings, Profile, Notifications.
  - Mobile: A simplified menu accessible via a hamburger icon, leading to dashboard sections.
Admin Navigation:
  - Comprehensive Sidebar: Left-hand sidebar navigation with extensive links for User Management, Listing Management, Booking Management, Payments, Content, Reports.
Global Elements:
  - User Profile/Account Menu: Accessible from the top right corner for all roles, containing settings, help, and logout.
  - Notifications Icon: Visible in the header for all roles, indicating new alerts.
current_prd.mermaid_erd_diagram:
erDiagram
USER {
  INT id
  VARCHAR email
  VARCHAR password_hash
  VARCHAR role
}
HOTEL {
  INT id
  INT host_id
  VARCHAR name
  TEXT description
  VARCHAR address
  FLOAT latitude
  FLOAT longitude
}
ROOM {
  INT id
  INT hotel_id
  VARCHAR room_number
  TEXT description
  FLOAT price_per_night
  INT capacity
  TEXT amenities
}
BOOKING {
  INT id
  INT guest_id
  INT room_id
  TIMESTAMP check_in_date
  TIMESTAMP check_out_date
  FLOAT total_price
  VARCHAR status
}
PAYMENT {
  INT id
  INT booking_id
  FLOAT amount
  VARCHAR currency
  VARCHAR transaction_id
  VARCHAR status
  TIMESTAMP payment_date
}
AVAILABILITY {
  INT id
  INT room_id
  TIMESTAMP date
  BOOLEAN is_available
}
NOTIFICATION {
  INT id
  INT user_id
  VARCHAR type
  TEXT message
  BOOLEAN is_read
  TIMESTAMP created_at
}
USER ||--o{ HOTEL : hosts
HOTEL ||--o{ ROOM : has
USER ||--o{ BOOKING : makes
ROOM ||--o{ BOOKING : is_booked_in
BOOKING ||--|| PAYMENT : has
ROOM ||--o{ AVAILABILITY : has
USER ||--o{ NOTIFICATION : receives

user_stories.title: Guest Account Creation

user_story.i_want: to securely sign up for an account
user_story.so_that: I can access the platform's features and book hotels

acceptance_criteria: Guest can register using email and password
Guest can register using social login (e.g., Google, Facebook)
System validates email format and password strength
A unique guest profile is created upon successful registration
Guest receives a confirmation email after sign-up

user_stories.title: Host Account Creation

user_story.i_want: to securely sign up for an account
user_story.so_that: I can list my hotel rooms and manage bookings

acceptance_criteria: Host can register using email and password
System verifies host identity and business details (if applicable)
A unique host profile is created upon successful registration
Host receives a welcome email with onboarding instructions
Host is assigned the 'Host' role with appropriate permissions

user_stories.title: User Login

user_story.i_want: to securely log in to my account
user_story.so_that: I can access my profile and platform functionalities

acceptance_criteria: User can log in using their registered email and password
System authenticates user credentials securely
User is redirected to their respective dashboard (guest, host, admin) upon successful login
System provides clear error messages for invalid credentials
User can reset their password if forgotten

user_stories.title: Create Hotel Room Listing

user_story.i_want: to add a new hotel room to the platform
user_story.so_that: guests can discover and book my property

acceptance_criteria: Host can access a form to create a new hotel room listing
Host can input room name, description, and capacity
Host can upload multiple images for the listing
Host can select available amenities from a predefined list
Host can set the base nightly price for the room

user_stories.title: Manage Existing Hotel Listings

user_story.i_want: to easily manage my hotel room listings
user_story.so_that: I can keep information accurate and up-to-date

acceptance_criteria: Host can view a list of all their active and inactive listings
Host can edit any detail of an existing listing (description, images, amenities, pricing)
Host can update the availability calendar for specific dates
Host can publish or unpublish a listing
Changes made to a listing are immediately reflected on the guest-facing platform

user_stories.title: Search for Hotel Rooms

user_story.i_want: to find suitable hotel rooms based on my preferences
user_story.so_that: I can quickly discover available accommodations for my trip

acceptance_criteria: Guest can search for hotels by destination, check-in/check-out dates, and number of guests
Guest can filter search results by price range, amenities, property type, and ratings
Search results display key information for each listing (name, price, rating, main image)
Guest can sort search results by relevance, price (low to high/high to low), and rating
System provides suggestions for popular destinations or dates if no exact match is found

user_stories.title: View Listing Details and Check Availability

user_story.i_want: to view comprehensive details of a hotel room and its availability
user_story.so_that: I can make an informed decision before booking

acceptance_criteria: Guest can view a detailed page for each hotel listing
Listing page displays all images in a gallery
Listing page shows full description, amenities, and host information
Guest can view an interactive availability calendar for the selected room
Guest can select desired check-in and check-out dates from the calendar
System calculates the total price based on selected dates and displays it clearly

user_stories.title: Book a Hotel Room

user_story.i_want: to book a hotel room for my selected dates

acceptance_criteria: Guest can proceed to a booking confirmation page after selecting dates
Booking confirmation page displays a summary of the booking (dates, price, room details)
Guest can confirm the booking and proceed to payment
System temporarily holds the room availability during the booking process
Guest receives a booking request confirmation (pending host approval)

user_stories.title: View Guest Reservations

user_story.i_want: to view and manage my hotel reservations
user_story.so_that: I can keep track of my travel plans

acceptance_criteria: Guest can view a dashboard with a list of their upcoming reservations
Guest can view a list of their past reservations
Each reservation entry displays key details (hotel name, dates, total price, status)
Guest can click on a reservation to view full details
Guest can cancel an upcoming reservation (subject to cancellation policy)

user_stories.title: Approve/Decline Booking Requests

user_story.i_want: to manage incoming booking requests for my hotel rooms
user_story.so_that: I can control my property's occupancy and guest flow

acceptance_criteria: Host can view a dashboard with a list of all incoming booking requests
Host can view details of each booking request (guest name, dates, room, price)
Host can approve a booking request
Host can decline a booking request, providing a reason
System sends appropriate notifications to the guest upon approval or decline
System updates the room availability calendar upon booking approval

user_stories.title: Process Booking Payments

user_story.i_want: to securely pay for my hotel booking
user_story.so_that: my reservation is confirmed and my financial information is protected

acceptance_criteria: Guest can securely enter payment information (credit card details) via Stripe integration
System processes booking payments through Stripe
Guest receives a payment confirmation upon successful transaction
System handles payment failures gracefully and prompts guest to retry or use another method
All payment transactions are logged for auditing purposes

user_stories.title: Process Booking Refunds (Admin)

user_story.i_want: to process refunds for guests when necessary
user_story.so_that: I can manage financial operations and resolve guest issues

acceptance_criteria: Admin can initiate refunds for bookings through the platform interface
System processes refunds via Stripe to the original payment method
Admin can view the status of a refund (pending, completed, failed)
Guest receives a notification upon successful refund
All refund transactions are logged with reasons for auditing

user_stories.title: Personalized User Dashboards

user_story.i_want: to see a personalized overview of my activities and relevant information
user_story.so_that: I can quickly understand my status and take necessary actions

acceptance_criteria: Guest dashboard displays upcoming bookings, past bookings, and relevant messages
Host dashboard displays new booking requests, upcoming check-ins/check-outs, and earnings summary
Dashboards are personalized based on user role
Dashboards provide quick access to key actions (e.g., 'Book Now', 'Manage Listings')

user_stories.title: Booking Status Notifications

user_story.i_want: to receive timely alerts about my bookings
user_story.so_that: I am always informed of important changes and actions required

acceptance_criteria: System sends email notifications for booking confirmations, cancellations, and status changes
System sends in-app notifications for critical updates (e.g., new booking request, host approval)
Users can manage their notification preferences (e.g., opt-out of certain email types)
Notifications are clear, concise, and contain all necessary information
Notification delivery is reliable and timely

current_prd.tam_description: Total Addressable Market for the Global Online Hotel Booking Market, encompassing all hotel reservations made through online channels worldwide.
current_prd.tam_estimation_basis: Based on global online hotel booking market size reports, including bookings made via OTAs and direct hotel websites.
current_prd.tam_source: Statista Global Online Travel Market Report 2024, Grand View Research Online Hotel Booking Market Analysis
current_prd.sam_description: Serviceable Available Market for Online Hotel Booking Platforms, representing the portion of the TAM accessible by a platform model that connects guests and hosts, excluding direct bookings that bypass platforms entirely.
current_prd.sam_estimation_basis: Estimated 80% of the TAM, reflecting the dominant share of online travel agencies (OTAs) and similar platforms in the online hotel booking ecosystem.
current_prd.sam_source: Market share analysis of leading OTAs (Booking.com, Expedia Group), industry reports on online booking channel distribution.
current_prd.som_description: Serviceable Obtainable Market, representing the realistic market share the platform can capture within the Serviceable Available Market over a 5-year horizon, considering intense competition and market entry challenges.
current_prd.som_estimation_basis: Conservative 1% market share capture within the SAM over 5 years, acknowledging the highly competitive landscape dominated by established players.
current_prd.som_source: Competitive analysis of major OTAs, new market entrant success rates in mature online travel markets.
key_competitors: local hotel chains' direct booking platforms
current_prd.advantage_summary: Secure and seamless booking experience, robust listing and management tools for hosts, intuitive search and booking for guests, secure payment integration (Stripe), dedicated dashboards, comprehensive notification system, global vision.

planned.model_content:
class Amenity < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :organization
  has_many :hotel_listing_amenities, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :hotel_listings, through: :hotel_listing_amenities

  validates :name, presence: true

  rhino_owner :organization
  rhino_references [:organization]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateAmenities < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :amenities do |t|
      t.string :name, null: false
      t.references :organization, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model Amenity name:string organization:references

planned.model_content:
class HotelListing < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :host, class_name: "User"
  belongs_to :organization
  has_many :hotel_listing_amenities, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :amenities, through: :hotel_listing_amenities
  has_many :hotel_bookings, dependent: :destroy
  has_many_attached :images

  enum :status, { available: "available", booked: "booked", unavailable: "unavailable" }

  validates :name, presence: true

  rhino_owner :organization
  rhino_references [:host, :organization]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateHotelListings < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :hotel_listings do |t|
      t.string :name, null: false
      t.text :description
      t.string :address
      t.string :city
      t.string :country
      t.decimal :price_per_night, precision: 10, scale: 2
      t.integer :capacity
      t.string :status, null: false, default: "available"
      t.references :host, null: false, foreign_key: { to_table: :users }
      t.references :organization, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model HotelListing name:string description:text address:string city:string country:string price_per_night:decimal capacity:integer status:string host:references organization:references

planned.model_content:
class HotelListingAmenity < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :hotel_listing
  belongs_to :amenity
  belongs_to :organization

  rhino_owner :hotel_listing
  rhino_references [:hotel_listing, :amenity, :organization]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateHotelListingAmenities < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :hotel_listing_amenities do |t|
      t.references :hotel_listing, null: false, foreign_key: true
      t.references :amenity, null: false, foreign_key: true
      t.references :organization, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model HotelListingAmenity hotel_listing:references amenity:references organization:references

planned.model_content:
class HotelBooking < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :guest, class_name: "User"
  belongs_to :hotel_listing
  belongs_to :organization
  has_one :booking_payment, dependent: :destroy

  enum :status, { pending: "pending", confirmed: "confirmed", cancelled: "cancelled" }

  validates :starts_at, presence: true
  validates :ends_at, presence: true

  rhino_owner :hotel_listing
  rhino_references [:guest, :hotel_listing, :organization]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateHotelBookings < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :hotel_bookings do |t|
      t.date :starts_at, null: false
      t.date :ends_at, null: false
      t.integer :number_of_guests
      t.decimal :total_price, precision: 10, scale: 2
      t.string :status, null: false, default: "pending"
      t.references :guest, null: false, foreign_key: { to_table: :users }
      t.references :hotel_listing, null: false, foreign_key: true
      t.references :organization, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model HotelBooking starts_at:date ends_at:date number_of_guests:integer total_price:decimal status:string guest:references hotel_listing:references organization:references

planned.model_content:
class BookingPayment < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :hotel_booking
  belongs_to :organization
  has_many :booking_refunds, dependent: :destroy

  enum :status, { pending: "pending", paid: "paid", failed: "failed" }

  validates :amount, presence: true

  rhino_owner :hotel_booking
  rhino_references [:hotel_booking, :organization]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateBookingPayments < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :booking_payments do |t|
      t.decimal :amount, precision: 10, scale: 2, null: false
      t.string :status, null: false, default: "pending"
      t.string :stripe_payment_intent_id
      t.references :hotel_booking, null: false, foreign_key: true
      t.references :organization, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model BookingPayment amount:decimal status:string stripe_payment_intent_id:string hotel_booking:references organization:references

planned.model_content:
class BookingRefund < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :booking_payment
  belongs_to :organization

  enum :status, { pending: "pending", completed: "completed", failed: "failed" }

  validates :amount, presence: true

  rhino_owner :booking_payment
  rhino_references [:booking_payment, :organization]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateBookingRefunds < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :booking_refunds do |t|
      t.decimal :amount, precision: 10, scale: 2, null: false
      t.string :status, null: false, default: "pending"
      t.text :reason
      t.string :stripe_refund_id
      t.references :booking_payment, null: false, foreign_key: true
      t.references :organization, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model BookingRefund amount:decimal status:string reason:text stripe_refund_id:string booking_payment:references organization:references
